Validate and coerce any object as data processing element

Source: R/04-harmo_process_harmonization.R
as_data_procelem.Rd

Confirms that the input object is a valid data processing element, and return it as a data processing element with the appropriate mlstr_class attribute. This function mainly helps validate input within other functions of the package but could be used to check if a data processing element is valid.

as_data_procelem(object)

Arguments

object

A potential data processing element(list of tibble) to be coerced.

Value

A list of tibble(s), each of them identifying a data processing elements.

Details

A data processing element must be a list of at least one data frame or data frame extension (e.g. a tibble) named 'dataProcess'. These elements are the centralised decision making to perform harmonization of each study-specific dataset. The tibble must contain certain columns which participate to the process, including the 'rule_category' and 'harmo_rule'. In addition, the data processing element may follow Maelstrom research standards, and its content can be evaluated accordingly, such as naming convention restriction, columns like 'valueType', and 'harmo status details', and/or any harmonization taxonomy provided.

Examples

{

# You can use our demonstration files to run examples
library(madshapR)

as_data_procelem(DEMO_files$`data_processing_elements - final`)
}
